0.Cons: Really long hours and customers can be a pain in the rear end.

1.Pros: Great customers, great crew, fun place to work, flexible schedule.
1.Cons: Limited opportunity for advancement unless you're willing to be available for a schedule that includes any shift 24/7. Low pay.

2.Cons: Mostly depends on management, although not all are bad some managers may be too laidback and will not help

4.Pros: Fun to work around people you know, its easy40 hoursgood pay for a fast food

5.Pros: Meeting People, you also would get regulars that you end up talking to . Usually you can guess the amount of the meal.

6.Pros: Fast paced, time goes by extremely fast, free food, plus discount for family and friends, work great with school schedule.
6.Cons: Very rude customers, unprofessional staff, staff spoke primarily Spanish around each other although they were all fluent in english, made me feel unwelcome.

7.Pros: They work well together, fresh product out put

8.Summary: "McDonald's is a great place to work..."
8.Pros: - Their benefits package is the best I've seen so far.- On the corporate side, there are MANY opportunities for growth.
8.Cons: - Can't think of any as I loved working there.

9.Pros: Your team becomes your family if you're there long enough. Free or half off meals depending on whether your store hits food cost. Lots of hours depending on your availability.
9.Cons: No one makes sure that employees do what they're supposed to before shift change. Promises of promotion that never come to fruition even if you have done your books. Failed occurrence system. Bend over backwards for employees that they could do without while screwing the hardworking and devoted employees. Health insurance sucks. No paid time off to full time employee under management. Biased and sexist raises.
